intro: Eurotia ceratoides, commonly known as the horned rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, horn-like bracts that surround its small, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to arid environments. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Eurotia ceratoides is also valued for its resilience and ability to withstand drought and poor soil conditions.
